docs.lead_paragraph: The government has raised its payment estimate for Medicare Advantage plans months ahead of a busy election season during which cuts to the program promise to be a key focus for politicians and voters.

headline.main: Government Hikes Medicare Advantage Pay Estimate
headline.print_headline: Government Hikes Medicare Advantage Pay Estimate

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Monday rolled back some of the more controversial cuts proposed for privately managed Medicare health plans used by the elderly following pressure from insurance companies and lawmakers.

headline.main: U.S. Government Rolls Back Proposed Medicare Advantage Cut
headline.print_headline: U.S. Government Rolls Back Proposed Medicare Advantage Cut

docs.snippet: The Obama administration on Monday rolled back some of the more controversial cuts proposed for privately managed Medicare health plans used by the elderly following pressure from insurance companies and lawmakers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health is the "great global connector" and ignoring disease in other nations will punish people everywhere as the world increasingly is connected by air travel and food transported across the globe, U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius said Monday.

headline.main: US Health Secretary: Nations Cannot Ignore Disease
headline.print_headline: US Health Secretary: Nations Cannot Ignore Disease

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate voted 59-38 Monday to resurrect federal jobless benefits for the long-term unemployed, and a small band of Republican supporters swiftly appealed to a reluctant Speaker John Boehner to permit election-year action in the House as well.

headline.main: Senate OKs Jobless Bill; House Prospects Slimmer
headline.print_headline: Senate OKs Jobless Bill; House Prospects Slimmer

docs.snippet: The Senate voted 59-38 Monday to resurrect federal jobless benefits for the long-term unemployed, and a small band of Republican supporters swiftly appealed to a reluctant Speaker John Boehner to permit election-year action in the House as well.

docs.abstract: A Canadian study has found that almost one-third of patients never fill the prescriptions for the medicines they are told to take.
docs.snippet: A Canadian study has found that almost one-third of patients never fill the prescriptions for the medicines they are told to take.

docs.lead_paragraph: The percentage of Americans without health insurance dipped to its lowest in nearly six years due in part to U.S. President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law, commonly known as Obamacare, according to a Gallup poll released on Monday.
docs.snippet: The percentage of Americans without health insurance dipped to its lowest in nearly six years due in part to U.S. President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law, commonly known as Obamacare, according to a Gallup poll released on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Scott Brown said Monday he will kick off his next campaign for U.S. Senate in Portsmouth, the New Hampshire city he says played a special role in his childhood.

headline.main: Brown to Start New Hampshire Senate Bid Thursday
headline.print_headline: Brown to Start New Hampshire Senate Bid Thursday

headline.main: Ezekiel Emanuel Further Explains His Prediction That Employers Will Drop Health Insurance

docs.abstract: “Look,” said Dr. Emanuel, “we talked to a lot of business owners. We talked to lots of consultants who deal with businesses.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Strange, sad and macabre, the discovery of the skeletal remains of twin brothers Andrew and Anthony Johnson has mystified neighbors and others in Chattanooga and beyond. Each man was found seated in an easy chair inside the modest home they shared for decades, and where they apparently died together about three years ago, with no obvious signs of foul play.

headline.main: Mystery Surrounds Death of Tenn. Twins in Home
headline.print_headline: Mystery Surrounds Death of Tenn. Twins in Home

docs.lead_paragraph: A growing share of Americans got health insurance as sign-up season for President Barack Obama's health care law came to a close last month, a major survey released Monday has found.

headline.main: Survey Confirms Gains in Health Insurance Sign-Ups
headline.print_headline: Survey Confirms Gains in Health Insurance Sign-Ups

docs.snippet: A growing share of Americans got health insurance as sign-up season for President Barack Obama's health care law came to a close last month, a major survey released Monday has found.
